definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: I am in struck with panically the hour just the attention arrive the mouth Diao of is a cake of abruptly of meat.
sentences.chinese: 我在驚惶失措時才注意到嘴裏叼的是一塊硬生生的肉。

sentences.english: Natasha, pale and panic - stricken, flew into the drawing-room .
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎臉色蒼白，驚惶失措，她跑進客廳裏去。

sentences.english: There was a stampede of panic - stricken crowd from the burning hotel.
sentences.chinese: 一羣驚惶失措的人們，從失火的旅館中跑了出來。

sentences.english: By this time Bertha was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 伯莎這時已恐慌得驚惶失措。

sentences.english: I looked up at Edward, panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 驚惶失措下，我擡頭看向愛德華。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
